column1: full, 141kph and swinging a touch down the leg side, Paine is unable to collect it cleanly and England pinch another to go with the wide
full and fast but again it curves behind the pads as Bairstow flicks at it and misses... Good diving take this time from Paine
fullish length, 146kph/90mph on off stump, YJB prods it gently into the covers
slung down wide of the stumps, very full and Bairstow jams down on it to squirt the ball wide of third man, good running brings them two
pitched up and sliding into the pads again, this rolls to short midwicket
full, up towards the blockhole, Bairstow clips it along the carpet to mid-on
banged in, 144kph and YJB smells the leather, drops to his knee and gets the gloves down out of the way. Well bowled, well played
full, straightening to hit the pads, there's a muted lbw appeal... pitched outside, maybe? Or possibly swinging down leg. But there's no appetite to review
shortish, rising over the stumps and Roy dabs one down to the on side
angled in on the stumps and Bairstow nudges it off his pads for another single
back of a length, comes across and defends on off
boshty! Roy picks up the first boundary of the day, up on his toes to a length ball in the channel, 135kph and smoked past cover for four
fullish and on a straighter line, tapped back down the track
nice line, 138kph outside off and nibbling a fraction, maybe staying a touch low as Roy steps out and shows it a straight bat
length, rising on leg stump as Bairstow uses the bottom hand to force towards mid-on
pitched up and swinging, 147kph on the toes, YJB does well to get his bat down  on it and squeezes out one past midwicket
dug in, leg side and Roy is hurried trying to pull... did it flick the hip? Well, Simon Fry calls it wide, to Starc's bemusement
fired full outside off, 147kph/91mph and punched into the covers
pitched up and crunched off the pads, lovely timing from Roy, using the pace and it whistles to the midwicket fence
full length, wide of the stumps, walloped on the drive but picks out cover, Warner then hits at the non-striker's end but Bairstow had his bat in
slammed short, 145kph and sizzling through into the gloves as Roy swipes and misses off the back foot
short of a length, 132kph and rising up towards the body, YJB tucks one down behind square on the leg side
slinky stuff from Roy, walks outside off and clips the ball fine, he knew fine leg had been moved around to deep square and it trundles away for another boundary
length outside off, dabbed towards third man this time
slightly short outside the line of off and Bairstow chops it past the dive of Smith at backward point
dug in short, 136kph and at the top of the head, climbing through to the keeper as Bairstow bails out of his pull short
pitched up and larruped through the covers! Stand and deliverooed to the fence, YJB hitting through the line, uppishly but it flew
slightly back of a length outside off, Roy taps down into the covers
Roy dances across, tries to flick to leg, 141kph and it comes back off the leading edge, Cummins trots down to field in his follow through
full length, 142kph and Roy seems to be through his shot early, the drive pops up but lands a few yards in front of Warner
dug in, this zips through and it is this far from the outside edge as Roy looks to fiddle one to third man!
full outside off, Roy prods at a drive but thick-edges to backward point and there's still no run
tight line, Roy comes across and pushes into the covers... that's a maiden from Cummins, excellent start and just the ticket for Australia
fullish on the stumps and worked back down the ground towards mid-on

good length, 137kph and coming back in, YJB drops it down by his feet and responds to his partner's call... it's not all that far from rolling back on to the stumps but they pick up one pretty comfortably
short at the body and flicked to fine leg, where there's cover now
angled in, worked down from over middle stump to the man at square leg
short and rising to hit the splice, 138kph, blocked short into the off side - this time Roy bellows 'No!' early
back of a length and rising past the top edge as YJB throws the hands at a cut... A good comeback from Hazelwood, just two off the over
sliding down the leg side as Roy steps into line, misses with a flick
dug in but there's plenty of width on offer, Cummins has been bowling cross seam but the ball just skids on nicely to allow Roy a good swing, crumped through cover point for four
length, 145kph and driven square, picks out backward point
banged in, this veers down the leg side as Roy chases the pull, can't connect
length, 140kph in the channel, spanked on the up but picks out cover
good length around off, 146kph and he shows this a respectful straight bat in defence
better lines from Cummins and Roy again taps it into the covers
and Cummins sprays the ball leg side again... Ooh er, radar's definitely gone a but wonky

full outside off, Roy aims an aerial drive... but it's snapped up at extra cover! Cummins strikes, making good use of the extra deliveries. Swung a touch and the ball might have stopped on him, Roy is a batsman not too worried about keeping it down but he couldn't quite clear Finch, who took a good catch above his head
full and pushed into the off side coming forwards
flicked off the pads, this looks like going for four but Cummins does brilliantly down at deep backward square leg to dive along the rope and keep it in play
good length around off, coming in and defended
rising up off a length, 137kph and Hales again shows it the maker's name
shortish and Hales chops down on it
slightly straighter line, this time he works the ball down towards midwicket and is happy to see out four dots
length, Bairstow pushes at it and gets an inside edge for one
fired in full on off, Hales drops his bat on it
good length, slightly wide and Hales attempts to flay the ball to Bondi, mistimed towards mid-off
full and straight and pushed without timing fine of mid-on for one
angled in on the stumps and tapped away
pitched up and this time YJB fails to middle and attempted drive, dribbles back past the bowler for one
full and wide, Bairstow chops down on it
fullish, 128kph in the channel and Bairstow brings out the hammer, plinks it to mid-off
angled in and worked through square leg

pitched up, Hales attempts to go over the top - but loops a tame whack into the hands of mid-on! Another mistimed drive and Australia have their second wicket, Stoinis doing the business. Nowhere near the connection Hales was after and Zampa took it well tumbling forwards
full, dobbly 132kph on off, Roor plays it straight along the ground to mid-on
length on the pads, Root is up and running with a couple flicked through backward square
fullish and worked away off the legs for one
short ball, cross-seamer but it's down the leg side, Cummins appeals as Root pulls at it... but Fry immediately signals wide
good length outside off, Root shoulders arms coming across
pitched up, 142kph and Root drives, eased past cover but mid-off does well to cut it off on the dive
angled in and turned short towards midwicket
slower delivery, maybe a cutter from Cummins and Bairstow watches it on to the bat and works square
comes across on off and defends
length ball, 130kph outside off but it stays a bit low as YJB swats at it and misses
short and wide and rasped on the cut, Smith was pretty close at backward point but gets a good hand on it and keeps them to one
length, driven on the up and that's all business from Root, timed through the covers and Warner has to pump the gas to catch up with the ball just in front of the rope
pitched up and pushed into the off side
dug in short, Bairstow rattles a pull through backward square, Cummins again surfs the wave along the boundary and one-hands it back in for deep square to field. [Jazz voice] Nice
length in the channel, dabbed down behind square
loops up the legbreak from over the wicket, pitching middle and leg, eased down the ground to long-on
full outside off, Bairstow swipes a drive out to the cover sweeper
floated up and punched through the off side as he reaches out for it
rolls his arm over, full outside off and driven into the ground, Paine appeals for the caught-and-bowled - but that was clearly a bump ball
pushed through outside off, punched past cover again
looped up full, Root plays straight and tickles one more down the ground to long-off
angled in and worked away through square leg for one
length, outside off, pushed back to the bowler
full, 133kph outside off, Bairstow crunches a drive to the cover sweeper
attacking the stumps, Root can only nudge to midwicket
trundles in, wicket-to-wicket stuff and again the batsman works to the man at midwicket
fullish, uses the feet and dabs a drive through point, into an unguarded part of the field and they hurry back for two
tossed up and straightening outside off, defended on the back foot
pushed through and YJB dabs a drive to cover
dragged down a little and this is played square off the back foot for one through point
looped up, Root is down early to reverse-paddle one past short third man, Warner scampers after it to keep them to one
flighted, Bairstow tries to heave down the ground and completely mistimes it to mid-on
tossed up nice and slow, draws a false shot as YJB reaches out and thick-edges one through backward square leg
good length outside off, 131 kph, pushed to cover. Can't seem to force that through extra cover because of that lack of pace
nice wicket to wicket bowling, full around off, hit back to the bowler
looking to glide that off the open face to third man but the ball came back in - not sure seam movement or an offcutter. Dabbed to point instead. Three dots
on the pads this time, 136.5 kph, flicked away to deep square leg
full and a tad wide, allows Root to stride forward and punch to the sweeper cover for a run
there is that dab to third man, gets two actually, fantastic running. On a length outside off, allows the ball to hit the bat, rather than going after it.
doesn't matter if you're bowling full tosses, Root swats it away to a straight midwicket
nicely bowled, full on middle and leg, some drift in the air, worked away to deep square leg
shortish and wide outside off, carved to deep point.

excellent batting, learnt from his error off the first ball, knew midwicket was straight and square leg was wide so when he saw a short ball, he went back and swatted it over where a normal midwicket would have been
more drift, full and straight, hit back to the bowler
full outside off, carved to the sweeper cover with the full face of the bat.

another good single. Full delivery, moving back in ever so slightly, patted away towards the keeper. Bairstow calls his partner through. Paine's soccer skill isn't the best, by the look of that attempt
in the air and juuust wide of midwicket. Fullish on middle, Bairstow clips the ball in the air, but just wide of the fielder, to his right
good length outside off, Root comes down and inside-halves the ball into his back thigh. Goes through his legs for a run. Ouch, could have been worse
full delivery outside off, driven into the cover region
short and wide outside off, Bairstow nails a cut but finds the impenetrable Steven Smith at backward point, who dives to his right to save two, maybe four
excellent finish, that's where you want to be on this surface. Full and straight, defended back. A tidy over

was there some bat? 82 kph, very full outside off, Root shuffles right across and sweeps to short fine leg. Steven Smith speaks to Zampa, who is conversing with Paine. They rightly decide against the review
driven into the cover region
lovely shot, some flight outside off, so much flight that Bairstow chooses not to move his feet and then lofts the ball neatly over cover. Didn't bother keeping it down

oh beautifully bowled. The previous one was the legbreak, this one was the googly. They both were really full, the length allowed Bairstow to throw his hands at the line without his feet. What that did was create a big gap between bat and pad, the legbreak found the middle of the bat, the googly found a massive gap between bat and pad, and hits off and middle stump. Sensational bowling, didn't shorten his length after he was hit.
another googly, 82 kph, outside off, not much turn, defended back. Excellent length for a wristspinner in that over, rather be full than short for precisely that reason
a full delivery outside off, dabbed towards backward point. Steven Smith picks up and throws at the bowler's end. Hits Morgan's bat, to the angst of the umpire. Could be to scruff up the ball.
full and wide outside off, driven elegantly to the sweeper cover
don't think Starc will mind that too much, there is some late inward movement. Full and straight, maybe a tad too straight. Morgan just tickles that fine, to the fine leg boundary
140 kph, wide and full, sliced to the point fielder. Is there some reverse swing? You tend to get reverse quicker on an abrasive surface

wow, probably what Australia were playing for, 141 kph outside off, gets the ball to jag back in. It takes the inside edge, hits the back pad and smells the paint of leg stump. An inch straighter and the leg bail would have fallen
full and wide outside off, neatly played this time, through cover for a couple. Played inside the line to account for that movement
too much flight, on middle and leg, driven to long-on

that's how Morgan plays, he backs a very productive shot and connects. Flat and straight, Morgan gets into a really good position and reverse-sweeps through backward point. Out if he missed, but it's a very safe shot for Morgan
did he get some bat? Don't think so, but runs given. Lots of flight outside off, attempts another reverse-sweep but it's too full outside off. Paine is put off by that shot, goes through his legs
some drift on middle and leg, driven to long-on
shortish and wide, 88 kph, wary of the reverse-sweep again, hit to backward point
good end, slow but not full, 89 kph, Morgan gets forward and defends
full and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover off the open face. So adept at finding gaps

will go down as a drop but those ones either stick or they go through like this. Full and straight, Morgan drives back, can't keep it down. Starc sticks out a right hand, but the ball bursts through. Don't think he got a hand on it actually
full and straight again, off the inside half to midwicket
141 kph, full on off, Morgan watches the ball onto his bat and defends. They'll look at playing Starc out
wow, terrific yorker. On middle and leg, tailing back in ever so late. Morgan gets his bat down on it just in time and jams it out
124 kph, the slower bouncer or the ball just didn't travel after pitching? On middle and leg, the short delivery. Morgan watches it onto his bat, always wanted to play Starc out
136 kph, full delivery outside off, driven to short cover. A hint of inward movement

135 kph, the first today but may not be the last. Root chops on. Was just saying Root is so good at finding gaps, and his natural instinct of trying to do so kicks in. It's a good length delivery outside off that seams back in, with Hazlewood's natural angle. The safer shot would have been playing with a full face, but Root tries to cut this down to third man for a run. It's not wide enough for that, but he still may have got away with it on a quicker surface, but not this. Hits off stump and England now in trouble. Batsmen will have to get forward and play with the full face.
another indicator of how slow this surface is, 141 kph outside off, hardly gets up, Buttler sways
full on middle and leg, 136 kph, driven to mid-on
full delivery outside off, defended into the point region.
Buttler spoils the wicket maiden with a jammed drive into the gap at extra cover
full delivery outside off from around the wicket, hit to deep cover. Looking for that off stump, or the one that got Buttler at the Gabba
good length delivery around off, defended watchfully
full delivery outside off, driven into the mid-off region.
141 kph, short delivery, clever change in length, well directed too, Morgan sways away
seams back in, 143 kph, on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket.

short around off, 142 kph, gets on top of the bounce so easily to bunt it away. Have to use the bouncer sparingly and to earn yourself a dot on a surface like this, the fuller ones are the wicket-takers
good stop by Mitch Marsh. Full outside off, Buttler gets forward and drives to short cover's right. Marsh dives to his right
he hits it harder and better and Marsh can't stop this. Overpitched outside off, drilled through wide mid-off. Marsh dives to his right
dug in, short around middle and leg, a top edge on the pull to fine leg, lands well in front
overpitched outside off, Morgan is a tad early through his drive, past cover for a couple.
full and wide outside off, left alone, 139 kph
shortish delivery outside off, punched to that short point fielder
134 kph, tapped into the point region, just have to keep it there on this surface
129 kph, full delivery outside off, hit to the mid-off fielder. Slightly wide of him, to his left
good length around off, 131 kph, skewed off the inside half to midwicket.
129 kph, worked away off his hips to deep square leg for a single
full delivery outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man, 133 kph
130 kph, very good over, not too pacey but accurate, around off, coming back in, defended back with the full face
85 kph, Morgan gets low for a fine paddle sweep to short fine leg
very good at these shots, flat on middle and off, reverse-swept away through backward point
93 kph, pushed through, Buttler plays with the full face, can often mistake the flipper for a short delivery, pushed to long-off
slower but short, pushed to long-on for a single
some flight outside off, 83 kph, the swatty drive to long-off. Reached out for it.

dropped by Steven Smith. Not easy but Smith will be disappointed. Short on middle and leg, pushed through. Slides on. Pulled to midwicket, where Smith gets low to his left, the ball pops out possibly off the wrists. Big moment in the game
lots of edges on this surface. Full delivery outside off, Morgan closes his bat face too early, a thick leading edge falls well short of mid-off
worked away off his hips to deep square leg
131 kph, Smith makes up one run, good length outside off, sliced off the open face to point where Smith dives to his right
juuuust short of mid-off. A lot happening here. Full and wide outside off, Buttler wants to go over mid-off but the ball lobs towards the fielder off the inside half. Lands in front
he has had enough of plodding about. Full and straight, Buttler goes through with his lofted drive, not great timing but his muscle does the rest, over mid-on. Lands on the boundary cushion.
shortish and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover. Warner is very quick on the ball
tossed up outside off, 87 kph, drilled through cover, lets his hands through the line. Two to deep cover
a flatter trajectory, on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
lots of flight outside off, driven to long-off with the spin.
drops short does Zampa, Morgan was waiting for it, goes back and pulls over midwicket. Cummins runs around from deep midwicket to cut off the boundary
short and wide outside off, slashed to point
87 kph, flight and straight, driven to long-off
shortish delivery around off, 128 kph, worked away down to fine leg
big from Morgan. Stoinis sees Morgan coming so he shortens the length, Morgan swats it away, gets amazing timing and waaay over square leg. Sensational hit
good length around off, defended to cover
on the pads, nudged away to deep square leg for a single.
walks down again, shortish delivery outside off, pushed to cover
timed away beautifully, short around off, Buttler crashes a pull to deep square leg on the bounce
on a length around off from Starc, played in front of point for one.
good length delivery outside off, 138 kph, outside-halved to point. Steven Smith gets across to his right
140 kph, good length around off, defended to cover
goes full, 141 kph, around off, driven to deep cover for a couple. Opened the bat face late to find the gap
a low full toss around off, driven to the sweeper cover. Not quite found his consistency, but that isn't entirely unexpected with Starc's pace
short delivery outside off, 138 kph, Buttler sways out of the line, drops his hands and lets it go.
short and wide and flogged over backward point, in the air but safe, just one to the boundary rider
full, this shapes away as Buttler chases the drive, swing and a miss
length outside off, 138kph as Buttler drops back and opens the face for one
touch short from over the wicket, leg-stump line and Morgan can only chop down on it
banged in, sliding across and it gets big on Morgan as he shapes to pull before bailing out of the shot
dug in and jabbed off the hip to midwicket - decent return from Cummins, just two singles off it
short ball, Buttler whirls on the pull and slugs it out towards deep backward square
length, 138kph and angled across, Morgan steps out and swipes over the covers for one more
short outside off, run down to third man
good length, 125kph on off, taking the pace off and Morgan tinkles a straight drive fine of mid-off, decides not to take on the quick single
banged in, slightly short and wide, Morgan swats a cut off the toe of the bat, rolls to cover

full, he steps into the drive, eased through the covers and this is well placed, Warner has to make up a lot of ground but he does well out on the boundary to dive and slap the ball back in and save a run
round the wicket, dug in short and Morgan gets into an awkward position pulling, played down through midwicket safely in the end
Buttler makes an early moves across on off, 137kph on a length and dabbed down, Morgan has to get his skates on but would have been home
length around off stump, solid forward defensive
fired in at Morgan from round the wicket, 141kph and he's up on his toes, wears it on the thigh and the ball loops wide of Paine for a leg bye
full length, 139kph and angled in, Buttler works it to midwicket
good length outside off, this touches 145kph/90mph and Buttler can only steer it straight to backward point
full, maybe a cutter on leg stump, Morgan made a little room and punches straight back past the stumps for one
angled in on off, 135kph and Buttler defends towards mid-on
Buttler advances, the ball is short in response and he's waiting in position to swing a pull away through backward square, a welcome boundary for England
fuller, makes a bit of room to swing the blade, thick-edged behind his legs but they come haring back for two
good length in the channel, 135kph and Buttler just runs it off the face to third man

gottim! Morgan tries to open the face but ends up gliding an edge to the keeper! Hazlewood makes the breakthrough, just as England were starting to look fluent again. Used the angle across Morgan, who played pretty well but is still searching for a major contribution
full, Buttler tucks one back down the ground to bring Moeen on strike
round the wicket, back of a length and defended on off stump
banged in short, 137kph and rising towards the throat, Moeen plays the pull pretty well and gets one to deep square leg
length, kicking off the pitch to hit the shoulder of the bat as Buttler pushes square
comes across and dinks one into a gap
round the wicket, pitched full and Moeen wafts a drive, gets an inside edge for one past his pads

dropped! A howler from Cameron White! Moeen gets a life, top-edging an ungainly heave straight up, should be a regulation catch at cover... but it goes right through him, a bar of soap in the showers, didn't get a hand on it - very similar to Hazlewood in the SCG Test, actually - and Moeen survives!
pitched up and driven neatly along the carpet to point
angled across and sliced for one to third man
pushes down the leg side as Buttler moves across
and another, Marsh straying behind the pads, again a flick and a miss but they take the extra
hits a length, 133kph on middle, Buttler stuns it back past the bowler for one
full and punched back to mid-off
short from Cummins, whipped away with a horizontal swing, firmly struck on the pull but again there's good work on the rope to prevent four
sliding down the leg side - another to the extras column
over the wicket, comes across his stumps and blocks
length, Moeen waits and opens the face, pushes square
fullish around off, dug out on the drive and it dribbles through mid-off for one
wicket-to-wicket, 131kph and worked off the front pad as Buttler shuffles across to find the gap at midwicket
pitched up and poked down the ground through mid-off

bowled him, Moeen drags on! He'll have to drag himself off, it's not been a fun tour with the bat for him... Back of a length, this time the ugly swipe goes down, rather than up, and raps the top of off stump - no chance for a fielder to mess things up and Marsh has a wicket
angled in on a length and Woakes defends
comes across, Woakes waits and punches one into a gap at cover
touch too straight and Buttler flicks it fine for one
full length outside off, Woakes pushes a drive past the dive of cover and they scuttle through
fired in on the stumps and Buttler breaks the wrists but this time finds midwicket

full, round the wicket and looking for that wicked reverse, Woakes manages to line it up and pings the ball firmly off his pads, Stoinis makes a valiant effort on the rope but can't keep this one in play
ripper, short and whistling through past the outside edge as Woakes hangs back and fences at it
fired in, this veers late but Woakes jams the toe of the bat down and thick-edges to third man
pitched up and timed into a gap through cover, they hustle back
full and straight and worked off the pad, Buttler seemed to amble the first and then the direct hit from Stoinis rebounded to cover - 200 up for England
oof, beats everything, full and zipping past off stump as Woakes drops the bat
floated up and drilled through the off side, that is Buttler's fifty - been a vital knock for England
flighted, straightening on middle and leg, Woakes defends
pushed through and Woakes steps across, pierces the off side and finds the gap for two
looped up full, goes down early for the paddle sweep, just gets one to short fine leg
spinning away outside off and Buttler guides it through the covers to the sweeper
tossed up and driven coming forwards, past the dive at cover and they pick up another single
slung down full outside off and Woakes squirts an edge past the keeper, third man prevents a boundary
pitched up, 142kph on off, prodded watchfully into the covers
full and straight and whipped cleanly but straight to midwicket
short now, slightly wobbly seam, Woakes swipes at the ball but fails to connect
blammo, timed over cover for four! Super shot from Woakes, who just sits back and opens the face on a drive, no chance for White patrolling inside the ring and it races away
full toss to finish, nearly surprises the batsman but he bunts one through mid-on
lobbed up and Woakes chips through mid-off, shout of 'catch!' from behind the stumps but the man was back on the fence
flighted, the googly this time and Buttler just waits on it, dabbed towards short third man and they scurry through
does him with the Bosie, but it's a fraction wide of the stumps! Woakes aims the booming drive but misses completely, a la Bairstow earlier
goes back outside off and runs one behind square
tossed up on the stumps and nurdled into a gap
touch short and Woakes backs away to hack a couple more over covers - no boundaries but another decent over of accumulation
Buttler walks out and is hit on the thigh as Hazlewood shortens his length, they pinch a leg bye anyway
fuller outside off, Woakes throws the hands and thick-edges past his stumps
short and he swivels on a flat pull out to deep midwicket
length ball, 138kph but drifting leg side, deflected off the pads for one more
Buttler does a little two-step at the crease, Hazlewood isn't falling for it, hits a length and he can only punch another single through point
sliding in with the arm, flipped in the air through midwicket and they have time to run a second
oh, foxy stuff from Buttler, he waltzes across and brings out the ice cream scoop, flicked straight over the keeper away!
slower ball, good length on off, Buttler taps it down
another cutter, taking the pace off as Buttler walks into line, tries a little short-arm flick but misses
another one for the wides column as Cummins pushes it down the leg side
full and straight and clipped through midwicket
good length, 143kph and seaming a touch, Woakes gets a leading edge short into the covers
oh, that's smoothly done, just a loft down the ground and it bounces for four! Touch full from Cummins, sweetly timed
dabbed down on the off side
full, he saunters across and flicks through square leg, one to the sweeper
length, 136kph/84mph outside off and it creeps through a touch low, Woakes jabs it into the leg side and Buttler wanted one, has to turn sharpish and scoot back to his ground
shorter, this leaps at Woakes like an eager cocker spaniel, jabbed away off the bat handle for one
shortish, deflected behind point via bat and pad, Woakes wanted it this time but Buttler wasn't coming... and Smith misses with a straightforward shy at the non-striker's end!
maximum pain exacted moments later, Buttler creaming a flat six over long-off! The beast raises an eyebrow and bares its teeth
short ball, slugged over the ropes at deep square leg! Woakes connects with a meaty pull and it sails for six, bringing up the England 250 in the process
short again but taking the pace off, he hops across and paddles this for one
Buttler backs away, another slower-bouncer from Cummins, following the batsman as he swipes and misses
super placement, makes room and opens the face on a squirted drive through backward point, they get a couple as Stoinis puts in the dive on the rope
banged in and hammered on the pull, sweet as a nut, smooth like tropicana - but straight to deep midwicket on the bounce
short, another cutter, I think, flicks Woakes' bottom edge on the pull but bounces in front of Paine
excellent start, fires in the yorker from round the wicket, Buttler can only jam it to backward point
dropped! Starc follows Buttler as he makes room, scooped off a length straight down the ground towards long-on... but Zampa grasses a difficult chance running in!
short, taking the pace off cleverly again, Buttler can't connect
another slower bouncer but Buttler connects with this one, boomed on the pull through square leg and the sweeper can't get to it despite a full-length dive
oh, shot - the topspin forehand down the ground! Not quite the yorker and somehow Buttler gets under it and smashes four over mid-off with those graphite wrists!
good riposte, speared full outside leg stump as Buttler backs away and fails to connect
length ball, Woakes clears the front leg but hammers a pull to deep midwicket

short ball, Buttler wants to ramp it but only toe-ends wide of the keeper... and there's a mix-up in the middle, both batsmen at the same end briefly, but Paine is unlucky in that his throw hits Buttler diving for his ground and it deflects to safety as Woakes scuttles back
slams in the bouncer but Buttler thinks it's high and ignores it - and gets the wide
smoked into the boundary boards, a fierce, flat pull and it goes all the way!
clubbed straight down the ground for six more! Humpty from Buttler, he dumps a full ball into the crowd - and he's into the 90s!
short ball, sits up to pull, this time Buttler arrows a jab into the gap at cow corner... he's now just four away from a remarkable ton!
full toss from Cummins, flubbed into the leg side... but it's a no-ball on height!
and Woakes manages to skim it fine for four more! Cummins' figures take a beating, he strayed down the leg side and it skipped away from Paine for another boundary

full and straight, goes for the reverse sweep... Australia appeal for lbw, and up goes Chris Gaffaney's finger! Buttler reviews straight away, however, and it looks like he hit it. Yes, quite a clear edge, then on to the front pad
full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Woakes gets this away, superbly placed, just a flick of the wrists and it's into the gap at cow corner!
banged in... and clobbered over the rope at deep backward square! Top-edged on the pull but there was no one out there and the six brings Woakes his fifty!
yes, he will, Woakes digs out a yorker towards backward point, England raise 300 and Buttler gets his chance

goes full and straight, Buttler can't really get under the ball but he forces it past midwicket... they are coming back for two, Buttler raises his century from the last ball of the innnings! He leaps in jubilation as he completes the second, helmet off to salute the crowd! This has been a brilliant one-day innings from Buttler, his fifth hundred and one to savour
full delivery outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man for a single.
beauty! 142 kph, on a length on a fourth-stump channel, the ball seams away and beats Warner, who indicates that the ball moves away after pitching
full delivery outside off, holds its line, left alone by Warner
full and wide outside off, 140 kph, chopped to cover point from the crease
144 kph, nicely played. Just strides forward and drives the ball to the right of short cover. Leant on the drive, not forced or over-hit. Warnered away.
shortens the length, good length outside off, 143 kph, dabbed to point
the perfect length to Finch, good length around off, the ball moves back and beats Finch on the inside edge, hit on the thigh pad
nicely punched in the gap at cover, full outside off, crisply caressed into the gap. Misread the length of that
can't bowl there, drops short down leg and Warner shovels a flick behind square for four. Too easy. An especially bad ball because square leg was up
136 kph, full delivery outside off, driven to short cover
135 kph, on a length outside off, opens the bat face and guides the ball to point
full and straight, defended to cover. Good over for Australia
good length on middle and leg, 142 kph, pushed towards midwicket
poor delivery. Strays down leg, off the thigh pad and past the keeper. Four leg byes to fine leg. All free runs for Australia.
lovely channel, just around off, 145.4 kph, played to midwicket, that strong bottom hand was evident
full, a yorker around off, jammed out to cover
146 kph, full delivery outside off, Finch stays back, should have been forward, toe-ended back up the pitch
lovely shot, back of a length outside off, Finch stays back and just punches a sliced push through cover point. Pulled inside just inside by a diving Morgan
good length delivery outside off, blocked back
beautifully played. Slightly short, and he loves them there. Just swivels on a pull and finds the gap behind square for four.
pushes it slightly fuller outside off, seams back in and goes through Finch's cut. Through to the keeper
good length outside off, 136 kph, Finch opens the bat face and carves a glide to third man

tries to force the ball through cover, but his balance was terrible. And all he can do is chip his wicket away to extra cover. Was around full, on a length. Warner stayed back to a ball he should have been forward to. Instead of adjusting his shot, he goes through with what he wanted to play, a forceful punch from the back foot, but his balance (and therefore timing) are way off. Can only push it away. Woakes is pumped.
good length delivery on middle, a 138 kph, thick inside edge to fine leg
dug in, short around off, defended back. Wood sprawls over, head first into the surface. Lovely day to go head first into a deep pool, but an unpleasant experience on a cricket field
shortish outside off, punched off the back foot to point
tidy channel, around off, blocked
142 kph, shortish again, think Wood is getting slightly carried away with that length. Not quite the surface to do this, short around off, pulled to square leg
attempts it again, a bouncer outside off, but deemed too high for legality
full delivery outside off, played to cover
shortish down leg, clipped into the leg side
good length delivery outside off, played into the point region from the crease

drifts on the pads and White picks him off through midwicket for three. Nicely played, just let the ball come to him before working the ball away. Hales picks up near the boundary, and throws the ball back but a shoe is in contact with the boundary.
full delivery outside off, may have kept a tad low, played away towards point

this one bounces extra, 132 kph, good length on middle and leg, some extra climb hits the splice of the bat. Toe-end and now splice off consecutive balls, of very similar lengths. In fact, this one was marginally fuller than the previous one
full outside off, driven into the cover region
a slower delivery outside off, 120 kph, tapped behind point with soft hands for a quality single. Well run
good length outside off, the ball seams back in, pushed back to the bowler
goes fuller, 136 kph, White was early through his flick off the leading edge towards cover
138 kph, full delivery outside off, the right length for this pitch, played defensively to point. White taking his time early
smashed! A half-volley outside off at 141 kph, but White creates even more power with an expansive drive through cover. Delectable
142 kph, on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket. A hand on it from the fielder takes some pace off the ball
nice end, 141 kph, tidy around off, defended back
back of a length outside off, 132 kph, came on slower than White expected, defended back
beautiful batting. Slightly overpitched from Woakes, White gets underneath the length early and lofts the ball over cover. A very T20 stroke, but works very well in ODIs too
good length outside off, chopped away to point
135 kph, on a length, down leg, nudged to deep square leg
a slower delivery on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for one. Good single, Billings the sub fielder there. Not sure who he is on for
well bowled, 136 kph, full on middle and leg, but not overpitched. Skews off the outside half to cover
142 kph, strays on the pads, Finch gets hit on it as he misses a flick, one to square leg
full on middle and leg, 141 kph, pushed to midwicket

edged and gone! A start for White but he perishes looking to force the ball through point. May have been done in by some extra bounce. Back of a length delivery outside off, White looks to hit the ball through point but all he can get is a thin outside edge. Was actually looking quite solid on a tricky surface
short and wide outside off, 145 kph, hit to point from the back foot
driven to mid-on from the crease
full delivery outside off, driven into the cover region
full and wide outside off, a thick under-edge to third man. Wanted to go over mid-off. Left nothing in the tank
shortish delivery around off, Smith walks across and nudges to square leg for one
full and wide again, shaping away, hit to short cover from the crease. The fielder dives to his right, and parries it away
nudged away behind square for a couple more. Just a bit straight there from Plunkett
on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
Smith tries to drag a flick from well outside off to square leg, but tickles it onto his body instead
some flight outside off, driven away to long-on
slightly short around middle and leg, Smith goes back and punches to long-on from the back foot, a bit of tuen
gives himself some room and slashes a cut to point
Ali keeps it on middle and leg, and that's right in Finch's wheelhouse, stays low and slog-sweeps the ball over midwicket for six. All power
slower on middle and leg, Finch pushes to cover. Wanted to go through cover again
shortish down leg, 89 kph, pulled to deep midwicket for one
overpitched there from Plunkett, driven to cover. Hardly any feet movement
131 kph, on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
short around off, worked to deep square leg for a single
lots of flight down leg, worked away to midwicket
quick, on middle and leg, nudged to deep midwicket
lots of flight on middle and leg, 81 kph, flipped away to midwicket
looks to open up that off side again, shortish on middle, chopped to the sweeper cover
great stop, flat and straight, pushed to Roy at midwicket, who dives to his left, and clutches his shoulder after the fact
flat and straight, nudged to midwicket
shortish and wide, punched to the deep point fielder
on the pads, and Finch works him away for a run to deep square leg
pushed through, very quick, on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket. Tidy from Mo
on the pads, nudged away to deep midwicket.
shortish and wide, scythed away into the point region
worked away towards midwicket

flat and quick down leg, Finch looks for a hard sweep, but can only get a bit of bat on it. The ball races down to the fine leg boundary, pulled up just inside the boundary by Bairstow, fantastic stop
flicked away to deep midwicket. Some riskless runs
short down leg, Finch has backed away quite a bit, chopped to point
drifts on the pads, Smith just tickles him fine, aware that the fine leg fielder is very square. Three to fine leg
what was Finch doing there? He should have ran two. Full outside off, Finch stays in his crease and mis-times a lofted drive over mid-off. Doesn't move for quite a bit, plonks over mid-off.
short on the pads, worked away to deep square leg
flat and straight, cut off the stumps towards short third man
a low full toss, 102 kph, punched to mid-off for one.
some flight outside off, 90 kph, nudged to midwicket
lots of flight, on the pads, worked in the gap at square leg
flat and quick, nudged to square leg
too full from Root, whipped away to deep midwicket

whoopsy. On the pads, Finch works the ball over midwicket, a chip shot. Over midwicket. Woakes runs around from long-on, looking to flick the ball to the square leg fielder. But he over-runs it and allows the ball go to the boundary. Not a happy afternoon for him to come
swept away to fine leg. A fumble by Billings, but no damage done
pushed through, on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
floated up full on the stumps and Finch sweeps him behind square for one
touch short, Smith throws the hands through a cut but sends it to point, he's disappointed with himself for missing out
pushes this out the front of the hand, skids on as Smith goes back and swipes it away
flat, not much turn and it's helped into the leg side to the boundary rider for one
flighted, the legbreak straightens on middle and leg, Finch gets down and paddles one more to deep square leg
dragged down a touch leg side and Smith nurdles one off his pad to short fine leg
pushed through with the arm and worked across the line
tossed up, Finch chips through midwicket, nice catchable height but it's square of the fielder
flat on the stumps and nudged to mid-on
floats this up and bit more and Smith whips one out to deep midwicket
darted on the stumps, Finch drops back but muscles a cut to the man at cover
boshed, he gets this one through! A rump-steak smash past cover this time, red-blooded and into the unguarded acres for four
looped up nice and slow, Smith pokes into the off side for one
full and flighted, Finch is down early to sweep flat through square leg
slips in the wrong'un now, spinning in as Smith goes back and punches to cover
tossed up and Smith cuts in front of square, he wants one but Finch is less keen and Woakes swoops to keep them honest
pushed through flat, driven playing back and Root misfields at extra cover to give them one
goes up for lbw, this skidding on into the front pad as Finch went to sweep... outside the line, maybe? Or perhaps he got something on it, as England don't contemplate the review
floated up and flicked in the air past square leg
here he goes, steps out and clubs over long-on, a hefty swipe and that clears long-on, bringing Finch his half-century!
and again, another Dorothy, plants the front foot and mows the ball over cow, a flat smear that is caught - just - by a policeman sitting guarding the boundary from intruders!
darted in and Finch settles for nudging this away to the leg side
lobbed down on middle and leg, Smith works the single
flat, no turn and nudged through midwicket

tosses up the legbreak, Finch goes to sweep, hit on the pads - and given! Finch immediately signals for a review, seeming to suggest he got some bat on it... but there's no bottom edge on the replays, and Hawk-Eye has it clipping leg stump! It was very close to sliding by but umpire's call is all England needed. Huge wicket, no hundred for Finch today!
floated up and Marsh pokes into a gap to get off the mark first ball
flighted outside off and Smith swings hard through a drive to the covers sweeper
slows the pace up, gets him reaching for the drive, mistimed back towards the bowler
pushed through outside off and Marsh guides one wide of slip
tossed up full on off, Smith punches to the right of cover
tossed up on middle and leg, prodded towards mid-on
sliding in and worked off the pads, Smith goes back and gets this into a gap for a couple
flat, worked with the (marginal) turn to midwicket
tossed up and jabbed towards point from the crease
flat offbreak, steered for a couple through the covers as Marsh opens the face
lobbed up on the stumps, tickled down the ground
floated up full, driven back to the bowler, Rashid sticks out a paw
flighted, goes back and works through square leg
pushed through, nudged to midwicket
pushed through on the stumps and Smith can't get this away into the covers
floated up and Smith tips and runs into the covers this time, taking cover as the throw comes in... but he was well home
floated up full on off, Marsh taps another single down the ground to long-off
there's no Finch but Marsh knows how to give it some tap, too, rocking back to power a drive in front of the deep cover sweeper
darted in on the pads, tucked to the leg side
fired in again and worked to midwicket
floated up, Marsh attempts to drive and it comes off the inside half of the bat to mid-on
drifts a little wide of the stumps with his line and Marsh neatly steers a couple behind point
dragged down and Marsh collars him again, roundhousing a pull past the man at deep square leg... Root grabs his cap and curses in frustration
tossed up and poked into a gap on the off side
gives this some air, Marsh leans out and strokes the ball to extra cover
flatter, drops back and crunches past the fielder on the drive, there's a sweeper out there
full and flighted and miscued back towards the bowler coming across
tossed up, Smith spots the googly and flicks it away off his pads behind square
drops a touch short and Marsh has width to throw the hands, crashed out towards deep extra cover but Woakes does terrific work to prevent four, diving full length to drag it in
full outside off, Smith crunches a drive through the off side for one
shortens his length, maybe a cutter and it dies under Marsh's attempt to pull
length, 123kph/75mph outside off, dabbed towards backward point
tight lines, over the top of off, Marsh blocks it back to the bowler
takes the pace off, cutter wide of the stumps but Marsh is in position to steers behind point, Wood slides along the rope to prevent four
closer to off stump, driven to mid-off without timing
angled in on the stumps and Smith works across the line
flat offbreak, driven firmly off the back foot but Moeen flings himself across and gets a hand on it
fired into the pitch, not much turn and Marsh forces one more down the ground
tossed up on off, Smith comes across and nudges to midwicket
touch short, spinning down the leg side as Smith goes back and flicks past Buttler, just a tickle of inside edge on it and Rashid has to scurry across from short fine leg to prevent it running away
pushed through flat outside off stump and this is cut through point for one
back of a length outside off, stabbed square
fullish, Marsh steps across to drive, Woake fields in his follow through
slower ball, in the channel and Marsh throws the hands, thick-edged down to third man where Wood cuts it off
length delivery, another cutter, Smith squirts it to third man along the carpet
pitched up, 135kph on off stump, Marsh drills it to mid-on
in the channel and taking the pace off again, Marsh swats one more through the covers - just three singles off the over
pushed through outside off, Marsh slides one off the outside edge
angled in and tapped to the leg side
flat, on the stumps, Smith waits and works the ball off his hip
tosses up the tempter and Marsh attempts to crash it down the ground, gets a thick-bottom edge into the crease
flat outside off and punched through point off the back foot
darted in the channel and Smith opens the face to steer the ball squarer, gets a couple this time
pushed through flat and chopped off the back foot to the covers sweeper
dobbed on the stumps, slightly short and worked off the hip through square leg
floated up full on off stump and Marsh checks a drive down to long-off
tossed up and Smith heaves across the line, firmly swept but picks out deep square leg
angled in flat and Marsh prods to midwicket
slows up his pace and Marsh can only push a drive to extra cover - so Root sneaks through a cheap one
Moeen pushes the ball flat on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
flighted, gets him coming forward to drive but Smith picks out cover
flat on the stumps, whipped away through midwicket off the back foot
tossed up and this spins, inside the bat as Marsh swings hard and misses, it clears the stumps and beats Buttler, too, running away for byes
fired in on the stumps and Smith smears the ball past midwicket, still only one into the deep
floated up outside off and Marsh punches another single in front of square
pushed through flat outside off and steered into the deep
darted down in the channel and this time Smith pokes to cover
flighted, comes across on off and whips behind square
flat delivery, leg-stump line and Marsh works one out to deep square leg
tossed up, much slower and Smith mistimes a cut to cover
quicker ball and Smith drops back and chops into the ground from in front of his stumps, Root scampers after it and finishes with another dot
Moeen continues to wheel away, spinning in on off but well played off the back foot past backward point for a couple
tossed up and mistimed on the drive into the covers
flat delivery on middle and leg, clipped through square from back in the crease
Smith finds the boundary! Tossed up and he sweeps powerfully in front of square, right out of the middle and it beats the boundary rider... Gets his first four, from his 63rd ball
flat on the stumps and chopped down the ground to long-on
pushed through, Marsh sits back and swats a cut out to the sweeper
full length, Marsh steps out and crashes past cover, in front of the sweeper for a couple
tight line, this time he punches to the man on the ring
length outside off, 135kph and driven square from the crease, picks out the fielder
fuller and straighter and worked through mid-on
good pace, 140kph in the channel and Smith flirts with the outside edge as he drives and misses

throws the hands, thick edge and Buttler snaffles a terrific low grab! Wood is delirious as he charges off...but Smith isn't walking. This is going to the TV umpire, and the soft signal is out, which could be crucial. Has he got fingertips under it? This is going to be incredibly tight, it's a fantastic effort from Buttler, but is there some grass involved? They are taking an age over the replays, but it's very hard to be definitive... And the third umpire has given it! The on-field call was key and Kumar Dharmasena has decided he can't overrule it. Smith is fuming, the crowd is silent but he has to go
yorker around off, jammed away into the cover region
flight outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man.
nice and slow around off and middle, dabbed towards short third man
quick on off and middle, pushed towards cover
pushed through, full around off, driven back to the bowler
lots of flight outside off, driven past cover for a couple. Long-off cleans up
short and wide outside off, an iffy start, slashed towards point, who gets a good hand on it. The sweeper cover cleans up
139 kph, full around off, coming back in, defended into the cover region
dug in but too short, goes over the shoulder, 137 kph, wide.
full delivery outside off, 138 kph, seams back in, pushed to cover

fine shot. Bairstow on the sweeper cover boundary messes up, and the frustration of the crowd is vented on Bairstow. Slashed away with immense power, but it goes through Bairstow, who is a terrific fielder. Worsened by the time of day
good length and straight, nudged to midwicket.
a slower ball outside off, 127 kph, dabbed down to third man off the open face.
Marsh biffs another very powerful drive over cover for four to get to fifty. Another fine batting performance this summer
pushed through, quick on middle and leg, defended
slow through the air, 83 kph, on middle and off, some turn too, guided to point
that's a confident shot. And runs give you confidence. Runs down to a good wristspinner early in his innings, backs his ability, gets to the pitch and drills a drive over mid-on. All the way
the googly on middle, 85 kph, nudged to midwicket
the googly, not sure he picked it, went back, his back pad right in front of off, but he got some bat on it and flicked to midwicket, read it off the pitch
flat down leg, worked to deep square leg
flat on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.
keeps a tad low, flat around off, pushed away towards cover from the back foot. Almost crept underneath the bat
flight outside off, driven towards wide long-off for a run. Bairstow quick on the ball to prevent two
flight outside off, driven to long-off, 92 kph
flat outside off, reverse-swept, or paddle reverse-swept down to short third man
lovely loopy legbreak outside off, short outside off, rips away and beats the bat
the googly on middle and leg, nudged to square leg

taken at long-on. And Australia stumble further. This is a huge moment, the set man has picked out long-on. There have been so many dismissals where a batsman mistakes a flat legspinner for a long-hop. Happened to Guptill against Zampa at this ground, think it was last year. Marsh goes back and looks to pull over midwicket, but the ball lobs off the splice towards long-on. Flat trajectory from Rashid. No doubt about this one
flat outside off, the legbreak, skews to point
lots of flight on that around off, driven back to the bowler
85 kph, slow outside off, pushed towards cover from the crease
good length on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
another slower ball, on middle and leg, nudged to fine leg for one
a short delivery around off, Paine gets nicely on top of the bounce and pulls to deep square leg
a slower delivery, 120 kph, around off, pushed to cover
good length on off, 135 kph, off the outside half towards cover
a slower delivery on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket. Tidy over from Woakes
luckily for Stoinis, he didn't go after it, flat delivery on off, a top-edged sweep to deep square leg, on the bounce
short down leg, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
flight outside off, driven to long-on for one
short down leg, Paine misses a routine flick, struck on the thigh pad
looking for the big slog sweep, but Moeen has fired this in outside off, goes past the sweep
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on
a slower delivery on middle, Paine is slightly quick through the pull, two down to fine leg
full and wide outside off, driven towards mid-off for a single
120 kph, another slower delivery, nudged to midwicket for one
a low full toss, driven away to long-on
another slower delivery outside off, dabbed to point
another tidy over from England, a slower delivery outside off, the ball creeps underneath the bat.
charges down and drives to long-on, got too close to the ball
flat down leg, following Paine, driven to long-on again
shortish and flat outside off, the batsman goes back and punches to the sweeper cover
in the gap for four. Flat down leg, Moeen follows Paine as he backs away, flicked with fierce power into the gap at square leg
well bowled, sees Paine backing away, fires a wide yorker, creeps underneath the bat
full and wide outside off, carved to the sweeper cover
a slower, wide delivery outside off, smashed to the sweeper cover for a run.
a low full toss outside off, badly-timed drive to cover
another slower delivery around off, chopped away into the midwicket region, Wood chases, picks up, turns around and misses at the bowler's end.
good short ball, on middle and leg, a top-edged hook to fine leg. Nowhere near control
comes down, sees him coming and Wood shortens the length, on off, Paine is hurried through his pull, goes past
a low full toss, 138 kph, driven to the sweeper cover for a run. Terrific over from Wood, executed pretty much what he wanted save a full toss earlier
flat around off, 85 kph, swept to deep square leg
well bowled, sees Stoinis coming and Rashid shortens his length but slow outside off, Stoinis improvises a checked flick to midwicket. Good cricket
short around off, Paine goes right back and pulls to deep midwicket
a googly down leg, 87 kph, pulled to deep square leg. Excellent defensive bowling
flat, quick and wide, driven to deep cover. Another fine over so far, can he finish well?
superb from Rashid, doesn't mind some flight on middle and leg, but does mind a full length, so the length is shorter, spins and beats the sweep. Awesome over
swatted for four. A short, slower delivery outside off, pulled past mid-off, to his right. Stoinis has been in great hitting form, Australia need another big innings to keep this series alive
good length around off, cut to deep point, one.
a short delivery on middle and leg, 141 kph, a top-edged pull towards the man at deep square leg
terrific bowling, good length but just inside the tramline. Boos from the crowd, but definitely inside the guideline, juuust inside but inside
and again, a full and wide yorker. Stoinis has backed away, looking to open up the off side but Wood is bowling it really wide so he can't reach it. The defensive bluff
just eight off the over after four off the first ball, a slower ball on middle and leg, heaved to deep square leg
power! Rashid does not want to bowl full, he is short and a tad wide, Stoinis stays back and lofts the ball intentionally over cover. Terrific batting
bye? Flight outside off, Stoinis misses a drive, the ball deflects off Buttler's gloves for one to third man
more flight outside off, Paine stretches and fetches, a hard sweep to deep square leg for a brace
quick outside off, chipped away towards the sweeper cover. Just one
this is really good bowling, sees Stoinis coming and shortens the length. Stoinis can only bunt the ball towards long-on with middling timing, which allows Paine enough time to come back
Stoinis charges, gets close, too close, unable to get underneath the ball, can only hit the ball to long-off. Another excellent comeback from a bowler who was hit for a boundary off his first ball

another fine start to the over, a good length delivery on middle and leg. Stoinis shuffles across, bends his knees, stays low and whips a flick into the gap behind square. His muscular power takes it over the boundary
a slower ball outside off, 122 kph, hit to cover for a run with bad timing.
full delivery around off, Paine nails a drive on the bounce to Root at mid-off. A boundary a few yards either side
a clever short slower ball around off, swatted away to long-on, two more. Good running
full and wide, was there to slice backward of point, but he can only mis-time a drive to the sweeper cover
a low full toss around middle, hit over the bowler for a couple more. Root at mid-off, runs to his right, but can't stop two.
good length on middle and leg, slashed to backward point.
a slower delivery outside off, under-edged towards the keeper. Stoinis steals the strike with a good call
there's four. Full and wide outside off, Stoinis reaches out for the ball and guides the ball into the gap between point and third man for four. Fifty for Stoinis
good length on middle and leg, heaved away to deep square leg. Just the one.
a DOT BALL! Valuable. Silence at the SCG. Short delivery on middle and leg, beats Paine's pull.
full and wide outside off, beautifully drilled but straight to the sweeper cover. Fantastic end from Wood.
a slower ball on leg, heaved to long-on. They opt to stick with one. Stoinis wants the strike.
a nice full, wide yorker outside off, jammed out to long-on. Bad enough timing to come back for two

and taken at deep square leg. This game's gone. A short delivery on middle and leg, the slower bouncer, forcing a tiring Stoinis to generate his own pace. He is too tired, all he can do is pull the ball to deep square leg. Billings runs in and takes a good, low catch.
there it is, a wide yorker creeps under Cummins' bat. Buttler is pumped. What an innings he played
a short and wide delivery, slashed to deep point
a slower ball on off, swatted to deep square leg and England win the ODI series. Wide smiles on England's faces, Buttler knows the quality and the significance of the innings he played!
